occasionally results in that DNA working
its way into the organism's genome and
that's a recipe for disaster so
scientists started looking at mRNA which
basically makes up the intermediary step
between DNA and proteins the result is
it could still get coded into the
protein but it can't be incorporated
into the genome the bad news is RNA is a
lot less stable than DNA so it wasn't
very useful because it kept breaking
down in the bloodstream before any
coding got done until now a company in
Germany called cure vac has found a
protein that it can bind to the mRNA to
keep it intact the results have been
fantastic it's cheap and fast to produce
it ships as a powder that doesn't need

high levels of antibodies and the

this protein doesn't change a lot from
